headline.main: Arteriosclerosis of the Heroes

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 -- The Gallup Poll has identified the ten most admired men in America and, what is worse, has published the list. As an index of our tastes in heroes it is a sad document.
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 -- The Gallup Poll has identified the ten most admired men in America and, what is worse, has published the list. As an index of our tastes in heroes it is a sad document.

results.snippet: HOUSTON, Jan. 9 -- At the age of 47, when most men get winded running for a bus, Capt. Alan B. Shepard Jr. of the Navy declared himself physically fit today and "happy to be back in business again" as the commander of the Apollo 14 moon flight...

results.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON, Jan. 9 -- At the age of 47, when most men get winded running for a bus, Capt. Alan B. Shepard Jr. of the Navy declared himself physically fit today and "happy to be back in business again" as the commander of the Apollo 14 moon flight scheduled to start Jan. 31.

headline.main: The Delta Wing Kite Is Providing New Twist for Water-Skiers

results.snippet: The hottest new twist in water-skiing is an idea put forth by Leonardo da Vinci about 500 years ago -- the concept of wings for man. This now takes form in the dart-shaped, delta wing kite which is breaking all records for air borne skiers.
results.lead_paragraph: The hottest new twist in water-skiing is an idea put forth by Leonardo da Vinci about 500 years ago -- the concept of wings for man. This now takes form in the dart-shaped, delta wing kite which is breaking all records for air borne skiers.

headline.main: Apollo 14:; Another Try After A Near Disaster

results.snippet: Another countdown begins tomorrow. Another manned flight to the moon begins next Sunday. It might have been just another moon-landing mission, fairly routine by space-age standards, had it not been for Apollo 13. But the near disaster of that mission...
results.lead_paragraph: Another countdown begins tomorrow. Another manned flight to the moon begins next Sunday. It might have been just another moon-landing mission, fairly routine by space-age standards, had it not been for Apollo 13. But the near disaster of that mission last April has placed a special burden on the engineers and astronauts of Apollo 14.

results.lead_paragraph: CAPE KENNEDY, Jan. 23 (UPI) -- Comdr. Eugene A. Cernan of the Navy, the Apollo 14 back-up pilot, escaped injury today when his helicopter crashed into the Indian River here and burst into flames while the astronaut was making simulated lunar landings.

The Arctic squirrel, the marmot, the brown bat retire into hibernation and let the chilling winds pass them by. headline.main: The Wild Blue Space Shuttle

results.snippet: ITHACA, N. Y. -- With a minimum of debate, the Senate recently decided to appropriate $110 million for NASA's proposed space station and reusable shuttle. Such a system, when completed in the late 1970's, will cost more than $14 billion, and could...
results.lead_paragraph: ITHACA, N. Y. -- With a minimum of debate, the Senate recently decided to appropriate $110 million for NASA's proposed space station and reusable shuttle. Such a system, when completed in the late 1970's, will cost more than $14 billion, and could pave me way for a $50- to $110-billion manned Mars landing near the end of the century.

results.lead_paragraph: LUNAR tourism -- on a fictional plane -- began in the second century A.D. when Lucian of Samosata blasted a single voyager off (propellant: a waterspout) in a fanciful story entitled "True History." In a second tall tale, "Icaromenippus," the same author launched yet another hero with a hand-crafted pair of wings.
